reviews.review_msg: Lectures are good, although there were a few slides that I felt had too much text. Just do and understand the homework, and you should get a good grade.

Gary Parker is an amazing prof but also the material in this course is quite difficult to understand. His lectures were great and he's very good at explaining things. Exams were very fair and just based on the assignments and textbook problems, but can sometimes be a bit tricky. If you take this course, do TONS of practice problems

Caring prof that wants students to do well. His lectures make a lot of sense and hw is helpful (not for marks and he posts the answers). He has clear expectations for whats on the quizzes/exams. He really likes to test your understanding on the exams. But as long as you read the lecture notes, study the tutorials, and do the hw, then youre good

Great guy and does a lot to make students have a better understanding of the concepts. Fair exams since he gives an outline of things he could test on so no surprises but exams can still be tricky. Definitely a better experience than the pre req for this course

Gary is a great and caring professor who genuinely wants his students to succeed. If you complete the homework he assigns, there won't be any surprises on the exams. The course covers a lot of material and is inherently challenging, but Gary does an excellent job making the concepts easy to understand.

I would recommend Dr. Parker to anyone who needs to take Stat 271. He is great at making the course content easier to understand and his exams/quizzes are easy as long as you study. He really cares about his students and does his best to support their learning.
Caring, chill, one of the best math prof at sfu. Great lectures and organization. Fair exams fair grading, the course itself can be difficult.

His lectures are pretty good; he explains a lot of the intuition behind concepts which helps a lot. Tests are pretty fair since most of the questions are based on the assignments. If you do the assignments then you should do well in the class. Overall he's a pretty chill dude.
